1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:48): Hello all
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:48): i am trying to get trac and svn to work with my apache 2
53abba0cd9c91aff0ee99d9d416c6a8e (17:49): !weather adl
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:49): can someone help me troubleshoot svn not working?
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:49): svn is see subversion
616abfefac6918b99f26c52732e3535b (17:49): subversion

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:49): subversion is a revision control system intended as an easy-to-use, fully-functional replacement for the Concurrent Versioning System (CVS); for more information, see http://subversion.tigris.org/ or join #svn on Freenode
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:49): hey nemlah. I need to get trac installed so sure, I'll help. Where have you got to?
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:50): hmm i am followiung the traconubuntu procedure
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:50): Oh, you're not building from the original sources?
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:50): and while i should see http://server/svn/project
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:50): nope
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:51): don't need bleeding edge
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:51): need it to work fast
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:51): That's not exactly what I meant. Are you using source code patched for ubuntu?
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:53): hi
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (17:53): does apache have "special" handling for urls starting with ~ when mod_userdir is NOT compiled into apache ?
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:53): i got some problems with ProxyPass

dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:54): when i do a ProxyPass / http://127.0.0.1:8081/ and ProxyPassReverse / http://127.0.0.1:8081/ in a <VirtualHost> and then surf to that virtualhost i get a 403 forbidden instead of what the server could fetch on http://127.0.0.1:8081/
616abfefac6918b99f26c52732e3535b (17:54): svn looks pretty wicked cool
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:54): noodl: i am using the ubuntu package
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:54): jpeg: it is

898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (17:54): what would be the cause, then, if I request www.example.com/~test , and that request is being handled by the MAIN server context instead of the vhost defined for www.example.com , WHILE /test is handled by the vhost ?
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:54): mxs: userdir?
1bfbeb35f0e6fa28418191898dde2af2 (17:54): jpeg: a guy svned his hoem directory over several machines
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (17:55): Nebukadneza: I already stated, userdir is not enabled nor compiled into the server
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:55): Nebukadneza: You probably have <Proxy *> Deny from all in your config somewhere.
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (17:55): jpeg: yes, svn is very very nice :)
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:55): noodl: thats true. but when doing a <Proxy http://127.0.0.1:8081/> with Order allow,deny and Allow from all in proxy.conf its the same :(
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:56): Nebukadneza: check your error log
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:56): client denied ...
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:56): oh wait ... kind of black magic
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:56): i think my local proxy cached the 403 :(
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:56): sorry
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (17:56): there is no need to be sorry Nebukadneza, next time just get it right!  O.K
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:56): mxs: Now you mention it, I have seen apache being wierd with ~ before. Lemme check.
dbe77e5191d2ab3112f35f7d5fe7cb5f (17:56): and thanks for the help :P
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (17:58): mxs: No problem with 2.2.2. http://www.carolpeace.com/~stuff
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:01): noodl: the apache in question is a 2.2.0 ... and ~something is just fine, but handled by the wrong context in my case
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (18:01): shit happens
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (18:01): the file is served from the DocumentRoot of the main server ctx?
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:01): fajita, forget wierd
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (18:01): mxs: I forgot about wierd.

c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:01): Hi all.apache default read html files at '/var/www/html',but this folder's permission is 'root'.So,when a web client visit the web page,it use permission with 'apache',how to make the session access a 'root' permission directory?
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:01): noodl: that is what it tries
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:02): noodl: the vexing thing is that the same file without a tilde is served from the documentroot of the vhost for that servername
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (18:02): mxs: Does your vhost have a DocumentRoot? Silly question but still..
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:02): noodl: yes.
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:02): noodl: you can easily observe that the handling is wrong, however. The Vhost has logfiles defined.
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:03): noodl: accesses to ~something go to main server log, accesses to something go to vhost server log
53abba0cd9c91aff0ee99d9d416c6a8e (18:03): fog_proxy:  Change the owner of the directory or make it world readable. The first would be preferable IMO
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:04): wobbles: you mean change all directories and file to 'apache'?
53abba0cd9c91aff0ee99d9d416c6a8e (18:04): If that is the user your server runs as
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:05): wobbles: How should I know which user my server runs as?
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:05): wobbles: I just run httpd with 'root'
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:05): wobbles: that is not preferable
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:06): mxs: so,how?
53abba0cd9c91aff0ee99d9d416c6a8e (18:06): fog_proxy:  In httpd.cof you wil find an entry which defines the user and group that apache uses
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:06): wobbles: apache should be able to read directories, not neccessarily write them unless there is a compelling reason
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (18:06): mxs: did you get your server from cheapomart or something? i can't reproduce this at all.. logging is fine and the file is served from the right place..
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:06): mxs: how about cgi?
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:07): noodl: hehe ... I will try to figure out what the root cause is. server is from plain 2.2.0 sources though.
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:07): fog_proxy: depends on your application. It is often a good idea to use suexec in that case, anyway.
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:08): fog_proxy: and the directory owned by something other than root AND apache
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:08): fog_proxy: in many installs /var/www is owned by root, but you can change that (and change which user CGI scripts run under, as well)
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:09): it really depends on whether you want a secure installation or an easy one
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:09): mxs: well,if I want it secure,how should I do?

be866e10acf0e336d23ada95d175b378 (18:09): hi - fresh install of Apache2 on Win XP worked - installed PHP5 - added c:\php to the path - php.ini sorted - httpd.conf added LoadModule php5_module "c:/php/php5apache2.dll" and AddType application/x-httpd-php .php plus PHPIniDir "C:/php" restarted Apache and I get Cannot load c:/php/php5apache2.dll into server: The specified module could not be found - any ideas?
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:09): mxs: just keep the directory setting?
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:10): mxs: and put my web files(owned by something other than root and apache) there,make it readable by other group?
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:11): noodl: odd. The error has moved on to greener pastures after yet-another recompile.
616abfefac6918b99f26c52732e3535b (18:11): WalkingBoy: what version of apache?

898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:12): fog_proxy: there are many possible configurations, depending on how much you trust the users of your system and what your application file is. You could, for instance, have them have the apache group and only allow read to group
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:12): fog_proxy: the idea of it all being that the apache-user cannot change the contents of your web directory even if it gets compromised
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:13): (and nothing else, for that matter, either)
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:13): when you want to use CGIs, look into suexec
616abfefac6918b99f26c52732e3535b (18:13): php on windows
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (18:13): php on windows is explained at http://www.zend.com/manual/install.windows.manual.php or for Apache 2.2, see http://www.iamcode.net/projects/apache/php-win
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:13): it's generally a bad idea to run CGIs as the apache-user
616abfefac6918b99f26c52732e3535b (18:13): WalkingBoy: ^^ see fajita's links, especially the iamcode.net one
be866e10acf0e336d23ada95d175b378 (18:14): jpeg: thanks :)
616abfefac6918b99f26c52732e3535b (18:14): php5 doesn't work with apache 2.2.2 without some futzing around
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:15): mxs: so,if I want run CGIs,how to set the permission?actually,I want run bugzilla with apache...
be866e10acf0e336d23ada95d175b378 (18:15): haha - ah I thought there must be something!
be866e10acf0e336d23ada95d175b378 (18:15): jpeg: thanks - I'll read :)
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:15): fog_proxy: as said, different possible ways. You could set them to run as, say, user bugzilla and have the directory owned by bugzilla, as well
18eb6e0ab77e11fdec364a1beadd07ac (18:16): fajita: ScriptLog context?
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (18:16): gryzor: ScriptLog may be used in the following contexts: server config, virtual host
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:16): fog_proxy: the stuff you are really interested in for that kind of setup is http://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.2/mod/mod_suexec.html
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:16): if you are using mod_perl or mod_php, however, that will not work
c6bf3cb3d8820b32300b1cb85399cc0d (18:16): mxs: thanks
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:17): (since those will by definition run as the user apache runs under)
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:17): this may be acceptable if you do not have multiple untrusted users on your system
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:26): noodl: try as I may, I can't reproduce the problem now. Sorry for the ruckus.
1b70f328e83584318ab35ff5c7c96056 (18:27): mxs: heh. maybe an old server binary running, or object files in the build tree?
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:31): it may be the latter, though that would indicate a failure of make ... The binary I stopped/restarted :)
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:31): and the final recompile was preceded with a make clean, to make sure
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:31): preach on !
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:31): buildconf is the devil, too
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:32): (not sure why, but when I run buildconf on a release tarball, the generated configure script treats --prefix as if it was not there ...)
898e82c94d7703e96f7ea83b31e0ac2b (18:33): yes, I always wanted 3 different apaches in /usr/local/apache ! :>
